alert.note: Alert for Boone; Hendricks (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 6:13PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Hendricks and Boone Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 613 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Brownsburg, or 19 miles northwest of Indianapolis, moving north at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Lebanon around 630 PM EDT. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 129 and 150. Interstate 74 between mile markers 53 and 68. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
